Criterion Text In: COHORT A: At least one measurable CNS metastasis, defined as >= 10 mm in at least one dimension
Criterion Text Out: COHORT A: At least one measurable CNS metastasis, defined as >= 10 mm in at least one dimension

Criterion Text In:
COHORT A: Unequivocal evidence of new and/or progressive brain metastases, and at least one of the following scenarios:
* Treated with stereotactic radiosurgery (SRS) or surgery with residual un-treated lesions remaining. Such participants are eligible for immediate enrollment on this study providing that at least one untreated lesion is measurable
* Participants who have had prior whole brain radiotherapy (WBRT) and/or SRS and then whose lesions have subsequently progressed or who have new lesions are also eligible. In this case, lesions which have been treated with SRS may be considered as target lesions if there is unequivocal evidence, in the opinion of the treating physician, of progression following SRS
* Participants who have not previously been treated with cranial radiation (e.g., WBRT or SRS) are eligible to enter the study, but such participants must be asymptomatic from their CNS metastases and not requiring corticosteroids for symptom control
* Participants who present with systemic stable/absent or progressive disease are eligible to this trial, as long as they fulfill one of the above criteria
Criterion Text Out: COHORT A: Unequivocal evidence of new and/or progressive brain metastases, and at least one of the following scenarios:

Criterion Text In: COHORT B: New and/or progressive brain metastasis(es) with clinical indication for resection
Criterion Text Out: COHORT B: New and/or progressive brain metastasis(es) with clinical indication for resection

Criterion Text In: Pathologically confirmed HER2-positive MBC by local laboratory with the following requirements: HER2 overexpressed or amplified (immunohistochemistry of 3+ or HER2 gene amplification by in situ hybridization with a ratio of HER2-gene signals to centromere 17 signals >= 2.0 or average HER2 copy number >= 6.0 signals/cells)
Criterion Text Out: Pathologically confirmed HER2-positive MBC by local laboratory with the following requirements: HER2 overexpressed or amplified (immunohistochemistry of 3+ or HER2 gene amplification by in situ hybridization with a ratio of HER2-gene signals to centromere 17 signals >= 2.0 or average HER2 copy number >= 6.0 signals/cells)
Criterion Rule: Disease is "Metastatic breast carcinoma" AND HER2+ is True

Criterion Text In: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of =< 2
Criterion Text Out: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of =< 2

Criterion Text In: Left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) >= 50% by echocardiogram (ECHO) or multigated acquisition (MUGA) scan
Criterion Text Out: Left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) >= 50% by echocardiogram (ECHO) or multigated acquisition (MUGA) scan

Criterion Text In: Stable or decreasing corticosteroid dose for at least 7 days prior to initiation of treatment
Criterion Text Out: Stable or decreasing corticosteroid dose for at least 7 days prior to initiation of treatment
Criterion Rule: "Corticosteroid" is True AND ("Stable" OR "Decreasing") AND ("for at least 7 days prior to initiation of treatment")

Criterion Text In: Concurrent administration of other anti-cancer therapy during the course of this study is not allowed. Note that concurrent use of supportive care medications (e.g. anti-resorptive agents, pain medications) is allowed
Criterion Text Out: Concurrent administration of other anti-cancer therapy during the course of this study is not allowed. Note that concurrent use of supportive care medications (e.g. anti-resorptive agents, pain medications) is allowed
Criterion Rule: "Concurrent administration of other anti-cancer therapy during the course of this study is not allowed." is True

Criterion Text In: The participant is >= 18 years old
Criterion Text Out: The participant is >= 18 years old

Criterion Text In: Absolute neutrophil count >= 1,000/ul
Criterion Text Out: Absolute neutrophil count >= 1,000/ul

Criterion Text In: Platelets >= 75,000/ul
Criterion Text Out: Platelets >= 75,000/ul

Criterion Text In: Hemoglobin >= 9 g/dL
Criterion Text Out: Hemoglobin >= 9 g/dL

Criterion Text In: Total bilirubin =< 1.5 mg/dL (upper limit of normal) except subject with documented Gilbert's syndrome (=< 5 x upper limit of normal [ULN]) or liver metastasis, who must have a baseline total bilirubin =< 3.0 mg/dL
Criterion Text Out: Total bilirubin =< 1.5 mg/dL (upper limit of normal) except subject with documented Gilbert's syndrome (=< 5 x upper limit of normal [ULN]) or liver metastasis, who must have a baseline total bilirubin =< 3.0 mg/dL

Criterion Text In: Aspartate aminotransferase (AST) (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase [SGOT])/alanine aminotransferase (ALT) (serum glutamate pyruvate transaminase [SGPT]) =< 2.5 x institutional ULN OR =< 5.0 x institutional ULN for patients with documented liver metastases
Criterion Text Out: Aspartate aminotransferase (AST) (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase [SGOT])/alanine aminotransferase (ALT) (serum glutamate pyruvate transaminase [SGPT]) =< 2.5 x institutional ULN OR =< 5.0 x institutional ULN for patients with documented liver metastases
Criterion Rule: AST <= 2.5 * ULN OR ALT <= 5.0 * ULN AND Liver Metastases

Criterion Text In: Fasting glucose =< 140 mg/dL and glycosylated hemoglobin measurement (HbA1c) =< 7%
Criterion Text Out: Fasting glucose =< 140 mg/dL and glycosylated hemoglobin measurement (HbA1c) =< 7%
Criterion Rule: Disease is "Diabetes Mellitus Type II" AND HbA1c < 7% is True

Criterion Text In: Serum creatinine =< 1.5 mg/dL (or glomerular filtration rate >= 30 ml/min as determined by the Cockcroft-Gault equation)
Criterion Text Out: Serum creatinine =< 1.5 mg/dL (or glomerular filtration rate >= 30 ml/min as determined by the Cockcroft-Gault equation)

Criterion Text In: Female subjects of childbearing potential must have a negative serum or urine pregnancy test within 8 days of initiating protocol therapy
Criterion Text Out: Female subjects of childbearing potential must have a negative serum or urine pregnancy test within 8 days of initiating protocol therapy

Criterion Text In: The effects of paxalisib (GDC-0084) on the developing human fetus are unknown and radiotherapy has known teratogenic effects so women of child-bearing potential and men must agree to use adequate contraception (barrier method of birth control; abstinence) prior to study entry and for the duration of study participation and 7 months after completion of trastuzumab administration per recommendations from the trastuzumab package insert
Criterion Text Out: The effects of paxalisib (GDC-0084) on the developing human fetus are unknown and radiotherapy has known teratogenic effects so women of child-bearing potential and men must agree to use adequate contraception (barrier method of birth control; abstinence) prior to study entry and for the duration of study participation and 7 months after completion of trastuzumab administration per recommendations from the trastuzumab package insert
Criterion Rule: "Paxalisib (GDC-0084)" AND ("Radiotherapy") AND ("Women of child-bearing potential" OR "Men") AND ("Adequate contraception")

Criterion Text In: The subject is capable of understanding and complying with the protocol and has signed the informed consent document
Criterion Text Out: The subject is capable of understanding and complying with the protocol and has signed the informed consent document
Criterion Rule: "has signed the informed consent document" is True

Criterion Text In: Participant must be able to swallow and retain oral medication
Criterion Text Out: Participant must be able to swallow and retain oral medication

Criterion Text In: Visceral crisis or impending visceral crisis at time of screening
Criterion Text Out: Visceral crisis or impending visceral crisis at time of screening
Criterion Rule: "Visceral crisis" is True or "Impending visceral crisis" is True

Criterion Text In: CNS complications for whom urgent neurosurgical intervention is indicated (e.g., resection, shunt placement)
Criterion Text Out: CNS complications for whom urgent neurosurgical intervention is indicated (e.g., resection, shunt placement)

Criterion Text In: Known leptomeningeal metastases (defined as positive CSF cytology and/or unequivocal radiological evidence of clinically significant leptomeningeal involvement. CSF sampling is not required in the absence of suggestive symptoms to exclude leptomeningeal involvement)
Criterion Text Out: Known leptomeningeal metastases (defined as positive CSF cytology and/or unequivocal radiological evidence of clinically significant leptomeningeal involvement. CSF sampling is not required in the absence of suggestive symptoms to exclude leptomeningeal involvement)

Criterion Text In: Patients with known contraindication to magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) (e.g., due to pacemaker, ferromagnetic implants, claustrophobia, extreme obesity, hypersensitivity, etc.). However, head computed tomography (CT) with contrast may be used in place of MRI at baseline and throughout the trial if MRI is contraindicated and a participantâ€™s brain metastases are clearly measurable by head CT
Criterion Text Out: Patients with known contraindication to magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) (e.g., due to pacemaker, ferromagnetic implants, claustrophobia, extreme obesity, hypersensitivity, etc.). However, head computed tomography (CT) with contrast may be used in place of MRI at baseline and throughout the trial if MRI is contraindicated and a participant’s brain metastases are clearly measurable by head CT

Criterion Text In: Chemotherapy or targeted therapy within 14 days prior to initiation of protocol therapy. No washout is required for trastuzumab
Criterion Text Out: Chemotherapy or targeted therapy within 14 days prior to initiation of protocol therapy. No washout is required for trastuzumab
Criterion Rule: "Chemotherapy" OR "Targeted Therapy" is True AND "Trastuzumab" is False

Criterion Text In: Has received prior therapy with a PI3K or mTOR inhibitor
Criterion Text Out: Has received prior therapy with a PI3K or mTOR inhibitor

Criterion Text In: No washout is required for endocrine therapy. If a patient has been on ovarian suppression for at least 28 days prior to initiation of study treatment, continuation of ovarian suppression is permitted on protocol. Starting a new endocrine therapy during protocol therapy is not permitted
Criterion Text Out: No washout is required for endocrine therapy. If a patient has been on ovarian suppression for at least 28 days prior to initiation of study treatment, continuation of ovarian suppression is permitted on protocol. Starting a new endocrine therapy during protocol therapy is not permitted
Criterion Rule: Disease is "Metastatic breast carcinoma" AND Ovarian suppression is True

Criterion Text In: Current use or history of receiving a non-approved, investigational treatment within 14 days prior to initiation of protocol therapy
Criterion Text Out: Current use or history of receiving a non-approved, investigational treatment within 14 days prior to initiation of protocol therapy

Criterion Text In: Subjects with a history of hypersensitivity to compounds of similar biologic composition to paxalisib (GDC-0084) or any constituent of the product
Criterion Text Out: Subjects with a history of hypersensitivity to compounds of similar biologic composition to paxalisib (GDC-0084) or any constituent of the product

Criterion Text In: The subject has an uncontrolled intercurrent illness, including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, uncontrolled hypertension, unstable angina pectoris, uncontrolled cardiac arrhythmia, congestive heart failure-New York Heart Association class III or IV, active ischemic heart disease, myocardial infarction within the previous six months, uncontrolled diabetes mellitus (DM), gastric or duodenal ulceration diagnosed within the previous 6 months, chronic liver or renal disease, or severe malnutrition. If a participant has controlled DM but is unable to monitor blood sugars at home, they will be excluded from the trial
Criterion Text Out: The subject has an uncontrolled intercurrent illness, including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, uncontrolled hypertension, unstable angina pectoris, uncontrolled cardiac arrhythmia, congestive heart failure-New York Heart Association class III or IV, active ischemic heart disease, myocardial infarction within the previous six months, uncontrolled diabetes mellitus (DM), gastric or duodenal ulceration diagnosed within the previous 6 months, chronic liver or renal disease, or severe malnutrition. If a participant has controlled DM but is unable to monitor blood sugars at home, they will be excluded from the trial
Disease: Uncontrolled Intercurrent Illness, Infection, Hypertension, Angina Pectoris, Arrhythmia, Congestive Heart Failure, Ischemic Heart Disease, Myocardial Infarction, Diabetes Mellitus, Gastric Ulcer, Duodenal Ulcer, Liver Disease, Renal Disease, Malnutrition
Criterion Rule: LK UII == True, UII == True, HI == True, ANG == True, ARR == True, CHF == True, IHD == True, MI == True, DM == True, GU == True, DU == True, LI == True, RD == True, MN == True

Criterion Text In: The subject is pregnant or breast-feeding
Criterion Text Out: The subject is pregnant or breast-feeding

Criterion Text In: No active, second potentially life-threatening cancer
Criterion Text Out: No active, second potentially life-threatening cancer
Disease: Active Cancer, Potentially Life Threatening Cancer
Criterion Rule: LK ACTIVE_CANCER == False, LK POTENTIALLY_LIFE_THREATENING_CANCER == False

Criterion Text In: Has had major surgery within 21 days before initiation of protocol therapy
Criterion Text Out: Has had major surgery within 21 days before initiation of protocol therapy

Criterion Text In: Active infection requiring IV antibiotics at the time of protocol therapy initiation
Criterion Text Out: Active infection requiring IV antibiotics at the time of protocol therapy initiation

Criterion Text In: Symptomatic intrinsic lung disease or extensive tumor involvement of the lungs, resulting in dyspnea at rest
Criterion Text Out: Symptomatic intrinsic lung disease or extensive tumor involvement of the lungs, resulting in dyspnea at rest
Disease: Intrinsic Lung Disease, Extensive Tumor Involvement of the Lungs, Dyspnea at Rest
Criterion Rule: LK ILD == True OR LK ETIL == True OR LK DYS == True

Criterion Text In: Known intolerance to trastuzumab that persists after appropriate medical management. Patients who have a history of prior intolerance to trastuzumab that is controlled after medical management and who tolerate trastuzumab thereafter without reactions are eligible to participate
Criterion Text Out: Known intolerance to trastuzumab that persists after appropriate medical management. Patients who have a history of prior intolerance to trastuzumab that is controlled after medical management and who tolerate trastuzumab thereafter without reactions are eligible to participate
Criterion Rule: "Known intolerance to trastuzumab that persists after appropriate medical management." AND ("Breast cancer" OR "HER2 overexpression") AND ("Trastuzumab")

Criterion Text In:
Corrected QT (QTc) interval time of >= 470 msec
* Note: The correction may be made using any method of QTc calculation
Criterion Text Out: Corrected QT (QTc) interval time of >= 470 msec

Criterion Text In: Participants receiving any medications or substances that are strong inhibitors or strong inducers of CYP3A4 are ineligible. Should a participant be taking one of these agents and is able to discontinue the therapy or switch to a different agent, no washout will be required prior to starting study medication. Corticosteroids, which are weak CYP3A4 inducers are allowed. Because the lists of these agents are constantly changing, it is important to regularly consult a frequently-updated list; medical reference texts such as the Physiciansâ€™ Desk Reference may also provide this information. As part of the enrollment/informed consent procedures, the patient will be counseled on the risk of interactions with other agents, and what to do if new medications need to be prescribed or if the patient is considering a new over-the-counter medicine or herbal product
Criterion Text Out:
Participants receiving any medications or substances that are strong inhibitors or strong inducers of CYP3A4 are ineligible. Should a participant be taking one of these agents and is able to discontinue the therapy or switch to a different agent, no washout will be required prior to starting study medication. Corticosteroids, which are weak CYP3A4 inducers are allowed. Because the lists of these agents are constantly changing, it is important to regularly consult a frequently-updated list; medical reference texts such as the Physiciansâ€™ Desk Reference may also provide this information. As part of the enrollment/informed consent procedures, the patient will be counseled on the risk of interactions with other agents, and what to do if new medications need to be prescribed or if the patient is considering a new over-the-counter medicine or herbal product
### Example 2
